column3: Upstream `univalue` wasn't (or hardly) maintained for a long time so we've at some point started maintaining it ourselves.\n\nUpdating the various URLs makes sense.

ACK a67d71311d59fb06c9d51369722c9656e497a729. Documentation should reflect reality.\n\nReviewers: please also consider reviewing a clarification to the README for our univalue fork: https://github.com/bitcoin-core/univalue/pull/17
The autoconf thing is still different, right?
@karel-3d I didn't touch that, as I have no idea what that line is doing.
Upstream univalue is still maintained. I'm not sure why @laanwj is claiming otherwise.\n\nThat we have a fork of it at all, is a bug.
@luke-jr it might be worth a separate Github issue to discuss if we want to migrate back to upstream.

> Upstream univalue is still maintained. I'm not sure why @laanwj is claiming otherwise.\n\nIt has very spottily maintained for a long time, and at the time we needed some fixes in. I haven't checked the status for a long time so it may be different now. I'm not "claiming otherwise" I think I was very precise in my wording.
